title: Chocolate-Dipped Strawberries
directions: Wash and thoroughly pat dry the strawberries. They must be completely dry for chocolate to adhere.
Set up a double boiler: fill a pot with 1-2 inches of water and bring to a simmer (not a rolling boil). Place a heatproof glass bowl over the pot, making sure it does not touch the water.
Melt each chocolate separately. For the milk chocolate chips, add 3/4 tsp coconut oil to help them melt smoothly.
Stir constantly with a rubber spatula until smooth and fully melted. Remove from heat.
Hold each strawberry by the stem and dip into the melted chocolate, letting excess drip off.
Place dipped strawberries on a parchment-lined tray.
Refrigerate for 15-30 minutes until chocolate is fully set.
notes: Chocolate chips contain stabilizers and don't melt as smoothly as baking bars -- add 1/2 tsp coconut oil per 100g of chips. For best results use chocolate baking bars (Baker's or Ghirardelli). Top chocolate brands for dipping: Ghirardelli, Valrhona, Guittard, Callebaut. Chocolate couverture (31%+ cocoa butter) gives the smoothest coating and best snap. For a glossier finish, temper the chocolate. If storing overnight, cover loosely with wax paper or parchment (not plastic wrap) and refrigerate. For transport on road trips, use a cooler bag with ice packs -- avoid direct contact with ice to prevent condensation. Take out 30 minutes before serving. If buying strawberries in advance, do NOT wash until ready to use; store dry in the fridge in a ventilated container with paper towels.
